qas.question: What percentage of electricity was made by steam turbine in the 1990s?
What marine engines were less efficient than steam turbines?
Along with diesel engines, what engines have overtaken steam engines for marine propulsion?
What engines were used throughout most of the 20th century to propel ships?
What gearing was used on steam turbine marine engines in the 20th century?
What percentage of electricity was made by power plants in the 1990s?
What marine engines were less efficient than gas turbines?
What engines, along with diesel engines, have overtaken steam engines for gas propulsion?
What engines were used throughout most of the 20th century to propel power plants?
What gearing was used on steam turbine engines until the 1990s?

context: The main use for steam turbines is in electricity generation (in the 1990s about <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2><b5_0>90<b5_0/><a0_0/>%<a0_2/><a0_1/> of the world's electric production was by use of steam turbines) however the recent widespread application of large gas turbine units and typical combined cycle power plants has resulted in reduction of this percentage to the 80% regime for <b8_0>steam turbines<b8_0/>. In electricity production, the high speed of turbine rotation matches well with the speed of modern electric generators, which are typically direct connected to their driving turbines. In marine service, (pioneered on the Turbinia), <a3_0><a3_1><a3_2>steam turbines<a3_2/><a3_0/> with <a4_0><a4_1><a4_2>reduction<a4_2/><a4_1/><a4_0/> gearing<a3_1/> (although the Turbinia has direct turbines to propellers with no <b9_0>reduction<b9_0/> gearbox) dominated large ship propulsion throughout the late 20th century, being more efficient (and requiring far less maintenance) than <a1_0><a1_1><a1_2><b6_0>reciprocating<a1_1/> steam engines<b6_0/><a1_2/><a1_0/>. In recent decades, reciprocating Diesel engines, and <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2><b7_0>gas turbines<b7_0/><a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/>, have almost entirely supplanted steam propulsion for marine applications.
